human: An arm is a limb of the body. The human arm consists of three long bones, the humerus, ulna, and radius.
The head of the human is the upper part of the body, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs.
A leg is a weight-bearing and locomotive anatomical structure, usually having a columnar shape.
The torso or trunk is an anatomical term for the central part of the many animal bodies (including humans) from which extend the neck and limbs.
